2. Enter email: tester1@test.com
3. Enter password: password123
4. Enter confirm password: password123
5. Tap 'Sign Up'
Expected Result: User is created and redirected to onboarding welcome screen. User appears in auth.users table in Supabase Studio.

Steps:
1. Enter email: test@test.com
2. Enter password: password123
3. Enter confirm password: password456
4. Tap 'Sign Up'
Expected Result: Error message 'Passwords do not match' is displayed. No user is created.

Steps:
1. Enter email: test@test.com
2. Enter password: pass
3. Enter confirm password: pass
4. Tap 'Sign Up'
Expected Result: Error message about minimum 8 characters is displayed.

Steps:
1. Enter email: notanemail
2. Enter password: password123
3. Enter confirm password: password123
4. Tap 'Sign Up'
Expected Result: Error message about invalid email format is displayed.

Steps:

2. Tap 'Sign Up'
Expected Result: Validation errors shown for required fields. Submit button may be disabled.

Steps:
1. Enter email: tester1@test.com
2. Enter password: password123
3. Tap 'Login'
Expected Result: User is logged in and redirected to dashboard (or onboarding if first time).

Steps:
1. Enter email: tester1@test.com
2. Enter password: wrongpassword
3. Tap 'Login'
Expected Result: Error message about invalid credentials is displayed. User remains on login screen.

Steps:
1. Enter email: nobody@test.com
2. Enter password: password123
3. Tap 'Login'
Expected Result: Error message about invalid credentials is displayed.

Steps:

2. Observe behavior

Steps:

2. Reopen the app
Expected Result: User is still logged in and sees dashboard (not login screen).

Steps:
1. Go to signup screen
2. Enter email: tester1@test.com
3. Enter password: newpassword123
4. Confirm password: newpassword123
5. Tap 'Sign Up'

Preconditions: User just signed up and is on onboarding
Steps: 1. Observe the welcome screen
Expected Result: Welcome screen shows Khepri branding and 4 feature highlights (daily check-ins; Intervals.icu sync; science-backed recommendations; safety guardrails). 'Get Started' and 'Skip for now' buttons visible.

Steps: 1. Tap 'Skip for now'
Expected Result: User is taken directly to the dashboard. An athlete record is created with default values in the database.

Steps:
1. Leave both fields empty
2. Tap 'Next' or 'Skip'
Expected Result: User proceeds to fitness numbers screen. No credentials are stored.

Steps:
1. Enter Athlete ID only (leave API Key empty)
2. Tap 'Next'
Expected Result: Validation error: both fields must be provided together or both empty.

Preconditions: On Intervals.icu connect screen with valid Intervals.icu account
Steps:
1. Enter valid Athlete ID (e.g. i12345)
2. Enter valid API Key
3. Tap 'Connect'
Expected Result: Connection succeeds. Credentials are encrypted and stored. User proceeds to next screen.

Steps:
1. Leave all fields empty
2. Tap 'Next'
Expected Result: User proceeds to goals screen. No fitness numbers are saved (all null in database).

Steps:
1. Enter FTP: 250
2. Tap 'Next'
Expected Result: FTP is saved as 250W. User proceeds to goals screen. Verify in athletes table.

Steps:
1. Enter FTP: 600 (above 500W max)
2. Try to proceed
Expected Result: Validation error shown. FTP must be between 50-500W.

Steps:
1. Enter threshold pace minutes: 5
2. Enter threshold pace seconds: 30
3. Tap 'Next'
Expected Result: Threshold pace saved as 5:30/km. Verify in athletes table.

Steps:
1. Enter threshold pace minutes: 5
2. Enter threshold pace seconds: 75
Expected Result: Validation error: seconds must be 0-59. Pace range must be 2:00-15:59/km.

Steps:
1. Enter FTP: 250
2. Enter LTHR: 165
3. Enter threshold pace: 5:00
4. Enter CSS: 1:45
5. Enter resting HR: 50
6. Enter max HR: 185
7. Tap 'Next'
Expected Result: All values saved correctly. Verify each field in athletes table.

Steps: 1. Tap 'Skip'
Expected Result: User proceeds to training plan screen. No goals created in database.

Steps:
1. Tap 'Race Goal'
2. Enter title: 'Ironman 70.3'
3. Set priority: A
4. Set target date
5. Tap 'Add Goal'
Expected Result: Goal appears in the 'Your Goals' list with trophy icon and priority A badge. Goal saved in goals table with type 'race'.

Steps:
1. Add a race goal (priority A)
2. Add a performance goal (priority B)
3. Add a health goal (priority C)
4. Tap 'Next'
Expected Result: All 3 goals visible in list with correct icons and priorities. All saved in database.

Steps:
1. Select 'Structured Training Plan'
2. Choose duration: 12 weeks
3. Tap 'Finish'
Expected Result: Training plan created with 12-week duration. Onboarding completes. User redirected to dashboard. Verify training_plans table.

Steps:
1. Select 'Daily Suggestions'
2. Tap 'Finish'
Expected Result: Preference saved. Onboarding completes. User redirected to dashboard. No training_plans row created.

Steps: 1. Tap 'Decide later'
Expected Result: Onboarding completes without a plan selection. User redirected to dashboard.

Steps:
1. Go through welcome -> Get Started
2. Skip Intervals.icu connection
3. Enter FTP: 200 and resting HR: 55
4. Add one race goal with priority A
5. Select structured plan (8 weeks)
6. Complete onboarding
Expected Result: All data persisted correctly in athletes and goals tables. User lands on dashboard. Onboarding does not reappear on next login.

Steps: 1. Observe the dashboard
Expected Result: Personalized greeting shown. 4 cards visible: Today's Workout; Training Load; Recent Activities; Upcoming Events.

Preconditions: User has not done a check-in today
Steps: 1. View the Today's Workout card
Expected Result: Card shows prompt to complete daily check-in. No workout recommendation displayed.

Steps:
1. Return to dashboard
2. View Today's Workout card
Expected Result: Card shows workout summary with intensity badge (color-coded); duration in minutes; workout description. 'Start Workout' button visible.

Steps: 1. View Training Load card
Expected Result: Card shows placeholder values ('--') for CTL, ATL, TSB. May show prompt to connect Intervals.icu.

Preconditions: User HAS connected Intervals.icu with valid data
Steps: 1. View Training Load card
Expected Result: Card shows actual FTP, CTL, ATL, TSB values from Intervals.icu.

Preconditions: User has no activities (no Intervals.icu or no recent data)
Steps: 1. View Recent Activities card
Expected Result: Card shows 'No recent activities' message.

Preconditions: User has Intervals.icu connected with recent activities
Steps: 1. View Recent Activities card
Expected Result: List of activities shown with: name, type, duration (formatted as Xh Ym or Xm), optional TSS.

Steps: 1. View Upcoming Events card
Expected Result: Card shows 'No upcoming events' message.

Steps: 1. Pull down on the dashboard to trigger refresh
Expected Result: Loading indicator appears. All cards refresh with latest data. Data matches database state.

Preconditions: User is logged in and on check-in tab
Steps:
1. Set sleep quality: 7
2. Set sleep hours: 8
3. Set energy level: 6
4. Set stress level: 4
5. Set muscle soreness: 3
6. Select available time
7. Tap 'Submit'
Expected Result: Loading/analyzing state appears. AI recommendation is displayed with: summary, intensity badge, duration, workout suggestion.

Steps:
1. Set sleep quality: 2
2. Set sleep hours: 4
3. Set energy level: 2
4. Set stress level: 9
5. Set muscle soreness: 8
6. Submit
Expected Result: AI recommends a recovery or rest day. Intensity badge shows 'recovery' or 'easy' (green). The recommendation acknowledges poor sleep and high stress.

Steps:
1. Set sleep quality: 9
2. Set sleep hours: 9
3. Set energy level: 9
4. Set stress level: 2
5. Set muscle soreness: 1
6. Set available time to longest option
7. Submit
Expected Result: AI recommends a moderate-to-hard workout. Intensity badge reflects this. Duration matches available time.

Preconditions: User has an active injury constraint (knee - moderate severity)
Steps:
1. Complete check-in with moderate wellness scores
2. Submit
Expected Result: AI recommendation avoids activities that stress the injured area. Recommendation text mentions the injury or restrictions.

Steps:
1. Fill in sleep quality only
2. Observe submit button
Expected Result: Submit button is disabled. Hint text shows which fields still need to be completed (e.g., 'Complete: sleep hours, energy, stress, soreness').

Steps:
1. Observe success screen
2. Tap 'Chat with Coach'
Expected Result: Navigates to chat tab. Coach has context about today's check-in and recommendation.

Preconditions: User has Intervals.icu connected with today's wellness data
Steps:
1. Navigate to check-in tab
2. Observe form fields
Expected Result: Some fields are pre-filled from Intervals.icu data. 'Pre-filled from Intervals.icu' indicator shown with checkmark.

Preconditions: User already completed a check-in today
Steps:
1. On success screen tap 'Submit another check-in'
2. Fill in new values
3. Submit
Expected Result: New check-in is saved. Dashboard updates with latest recommendation. Both check-ins visible in history.

Preconditions: User has completed multiple check-ins over several days
Steps:
1. Tap 'View History' on check-in tab
2. Observe history list
Expected Result: Check-ins listed in reverse chronological order. Each shows: date, intensity dot, wellness score %, metric badges (sleep, energy, stress, soreness), recommendation summary.

Preconditions: User has never completed a check-in
Steps: 1. Navigate to check-in history
Expected Result: Empty state shown: calendar icon, 'No check-ins yet' message, 'Start Check-in' button.

Preconditions: User has check-ins from today and yesterday and older
Steps: 1. View check-in history
Expected Result: Today's check-in shows 'Today'. Yesterday's shows 'Yesterday'. Older shows formatted date (e.g. 'Mon, Feb 10').

Steps: 1. Navigate to Coach/Chat tab
Expected Result: Welcome message displayed: 'Hi! I'm your Khepri AI coach...' Info card shown about personalized responses. Suggested prompts visible.

Use Case: Send first message via suggested prompt
Preconditions: On chat tab with suggested prompts visible
Steps: 1. Tap 'What should I focus on this week?'
Expected Result: Prompt text fills the input field. User can review and send.

Use Case: Send a message and receive response
Steps:
1. Type 'What should I do for my swim session today?'
2. Tap send
Expected Result: 'Sending...' indicator appears. AI response streams in. User message appears right-aligned (primary color). Assistant response appears left-aligned. Response is personalized to user's fitness data and goals.

Preconditions: Previous message sent and response received
Steps:
1. Send follow-up: 'Can you make it shorter? I only have 30 minutes.'
2. Wait for response
Expected Result: AI responds contextually referencing the previous workout suggestion. Modified workout fits within 30 minutes.

Preconditions: User has fitness numbers and goals set
Steps: 1. Ask 'What is my current FTP and what should I target?'
Expected Result: AI response references the user's actual FTP value from their profile. Recommendations are specific to their level.

Preconditions: User has active knee injury constraint
Steps: 1. Ask 'Plan my training for this week'
Expected Result: AI response acknowledges the knee injury. No running-heavy workouts suggested (or modifications noted). Injury is mentioned explicitly.

Preconditions: User completed today's check-in with poor sleep
Steps: 1. Ask 'Why am I feeling tired today?'
Expected Result: AI references today's check-in data (low sleep quality/hours). Provides recovery advice grounded in the actual data.

Preconditions: AI service is unreachable (e.g. invalid API key)
Steps:
1. Send a message
2. Wait for response
Expected Result: Error state appears with retry button. Failed message text is restored to input field for retry.

Steps:
1. Send several messages back and forth
2. Observe scrolling behavior
Expected Result: Chat auto-scrolls to newest message. Older messages accessible by scrolling up. No UI glitches or overlapping.

Steps:
1. Leave input empty
2. Observe send button
Expected Result: Send button is disabled when input is empty.

Preconditions: User has a race goal set for 8 weeks from now
Steps: 1. Ask 'How should I structure my training leading up to my race?'
Expected Result: AI provides a periodized approach mentioning: base building; build phase; taper. References the specific race and timeline. Advice is sport-appropriate.

Preconditions: User did a hard workout yesterday (visible in Intervals.icu)
Steps: 1. Ask 'What should I do for recovery today?'
Expected Result: AI references yesterday's hard effort. Suggests appropriate recovery: easy spin, foam rolling, stretching, or rest. Does not suggest another hard workout.

Preconditions: User completed onboarding with some data
Steps: 1. Navigate to Profile tab
Expected Result: Profile header shows avatar with initials, display name, units, timezone. Sections visible: Profile, Connections, Preferences, Support.

Steps:
1. Tap 'Personal Info'
2. Change display name to 'Test Athlete'
3. Enter weight: 75 (kg)
4. Enter height: 180 (cm)
5. Tap 'Save Changes'
Expected Result: Success confirmation. Returning to profile shows updated name. Verify in athletes table: weight=75

Preconditions: On personal info screen in metric
Steps:
1. Change units from Metric to Imperial
2. Observe weight and height fields
Expected Result: Weight and height fields are cleared (to prevent confusion). Labels change to lbs and inches.

Preconditions: On personal info screen with Imperial selected
Steps:
1. Enter weight: 165 (lbs)
2. Enter height: 71 (in)
3. Tap 'Save Changes'
Expected Result: Values saved. Verify in database: weight stored in kg (~74.8), height stored in cm (~180.3). Values display correctly in Imperial on reload.

Steps:
1. Clear display name (leave empty)
2. Enter weight: 999
3. Tap 'Save Changes'
Expected Result: Validation errors: display name required, weight out of range. Changes not saved.

Steps:
1. Tap 'Fitness Numbers'
2. Enter FTP: 280
3. Enter threshold pace: 4:30
4. Enter CSS: 1:40
5. Enter resting HR: 48
6. Enter max HR: 190
7. Tap 'Save Changes'
Expected Result: All values saved correctly. Verify in athletes table. Values display correctly on reload.

Steps:
1. Enter FTP: 10 (below 50 minimum)
2. Enter resting HR: 200 (above 100 max)
3. Try to save
Expected Result: Validation errors for out-of-range values. FTP must be 50-500, resting HR must be 30-100.

Steps: 1. Tap 'Goals' from profile
Expected Result: Active goals shown with count header. Each goal shows: type icon, title, priority badge (color-coded A/B/C), subtitle, target date.

Steps:
1. Tap 'Race Goal' card
2. Enter title: 'Local Sprint Triathlon'
3. Enter event name: 'City Sprint Tri'
4. Select distance: 'Sprint Tri'
5. Set target date
6. Set priority: A
7. Tap 'Add Goal'
Expected Result: Goal added and appears in active goals list. Verify in goals table with type='race'.

Steps:
1. Tap 'Performance Goal'
2. Enter title: 'Increase FTP'
3. Select metric: FTP
4. Enter current value: 250
5. Enter target value: 280
6. Set priority: B
7. Tap 'Add Goal'
Expected Result: Goal added with trending-up icon and priority B badge. Verify in goals table.

Preconditions: On goals screen with existing goals
Steps:
1. Tap on an existing goal
2. Change title
3. Change priority from B to A
4. Tap 'Save Changes'
Expected Result: Goal updated. List reflects changes. Database updated.

Steps:
1. Tap 'Delete Goal'
2. Confirm deletion in alert dialog
Expected Result: Goal removed from list. Verify deleted from goals table (or status changed).

Steps: 1. Tap 'Constraints'
Expected Result: Constraints screen shows any active constraints with type icons (bandage/airplane/time), color coding, and date ranges. Or shows empty state.

Steps:
1. Tap 'Injury' card
2. Enter title: 'Left knee pain'
3. Select body part: Knees
4. Select severity: Moderate
5. Check restrictions: 'No running' and 'No high intensity'
6. Set start date to today
7. Tap 'Add Constraint'
Expected Result: Constraint appears in active list with red color, bandage icon. Subtitle shows 'knees | Moderate'. Verify in constraints table.

Steps:
1. Tap 'Travel' card
2. Enter title: 'Business trip'
3. Enter destination: 'London'
4. Check equipment: 'Running shoes' and 'Heart rate monitor'
5. Check facilities: 'Hotel gym' and 'Outdoor running'
6. Set start and end dates
7. Tap 'Add Constraint'
Expected Result: Constraint appears with blue color, airplane icon. Destination shown in subtitle. Verify in database.

Steps:
1. Tap 'Availability Change' card
2. Enter title: 'Busy work week'
3. Enter available hours: 5
4. Check available days: Mon, Wed, Sat
5. Set start and end dates
6. Tap 'Add Constraint'
Expected Result: Constraint appears with yellow color, time icon. '5 hrs/week' shown in subtitle. Verify in database.

Preconditions: On constraints screen with active injury
Steps:
1. Tap on active injury constraint
2. Tap 'Mark as Resolved'
Expected Result: Constraint moves from Active to Resolved section. 'Resolved' badge visible. Status updated in database.

Steps:
1. Tap 'Delete Constraint'
2. Confirm deletion
Expected Result: Constraint removed from list. Deleted from database.

Steps:
1. Leave title empty
2. Leave required fields empty
3. Tap 'Add Constraint'
Expected Result: Validation errors shown for required fields (title and type-specific fields).

Preconditions: User is NOT connected to Intervals.icu
Steps:
1. Go to Profile > Intervals.icu
2. Enter valid Athlete ID
3. Enter valid API Key
4. Tap 'Connect'
Expected Result: Success alert shown. Status changes to 'Connected' with green badge. Athlete ID displayed. Credentials encrypted in database.

Steps:
1. Enter Athlete ID: i99999
2. Enter API Key: invalidkey12345678901234
3. Tap 'Connect'
Expected Result: Error alert shown. Connection does not succeed. Status remains 'Not Connected'.

Use Case: Connect with invalid Athlete ID format
Steps:
1. Enter Athlete ID: abc (not matching i?\d+ pattern)
2. Observe validation
Expected Result: Validation error for Athlete ID format.

Steps:
1. Enter Athlete ID: i12345
2. Enter API Key: short (less than 20 chars)
3. Observe validation
Expected Result: Validation error for API Key length (minimum 20 characters).

Steps:
1. Go to Profile > Intervals.icu
2. Tap 'Disconnect'
3. Confirm in dialog
Expected Result: Status changes to 'Not Connected'. Credentials removed from database. Dashboard training load shows '--' placeholders.

Preconditions: User just connected Intervals.icu with real data
Steps:
1. Go to Dashboard
2. Pull to refresh
3. Check Training Load card
4. Check Recent Activities card
Expected Result: Training Load shows real CTL, ATL, TSB values. Recent Activities shows workouts from Intervals.icu.

Steps:
1. Complete check-in with moderate wellness
2. Check AI recommendation
Expected Result: AI recommends reduced intensity or recovery. Does NOT suggest a hard workout when fatigued. Safety warning or explanation about training load may be included.

Preconditions: User has active knee injury (moderate severity) with 'no running' restriction
Steps: 1. Ask AI coach: 'What workout should I do today?'
Expected Result: AI does NOT recommend running. Suggests alternatives (swimming, cycling, upper body). Explicitly mentions the knee injury restriction.

Preconditions: User reports 3 hours of sleep in check-in
Steps:
1. Complete check-in with sleep hours: 3 and sleep quality: 1
2. Submit and view recommendation
Expected Result: AI prioritizes rest or very light recovery. Does NOT suggest intense training. Mentions sleep deprivation as a concern.

Preconditions: User reports stress level 9-10 in check-in
Steps:
1. Complete check-in with stress: 10
2. Submit and view recommendation
Expected Result: AI acknowledges high stress. Recommends lower intensity or stress-reducing activity (easy jog or yoga). Does not pile on more stress.

Preconditions: User has: poor sleep (3hrs); high soreness (9); active injury
Steps:
1. Complete check-in with these values
2. Submit
Expected Result: AI strongly recommends complete rest day. Multiple safety concerns acknowledged. No workout that could worsen any condition.

Preconditions: User had hard workouts the last 2 days (visible in activities, if Intervals.icu connected)
Steps: 1. Ask coach: 'Should I go hard again today?'
Expected Result: AI advises against a third consecutive hard day. References the principle of hard/easy alternation or suggests recovery.

Use Case: User A cannot see User B data
Preconditions: Two test accounts exist with different data
Steps:
1. Log in as User A - note their goals and check-ins
2. Log out
3. Log in as User B
4. Check goals, constraints, check-ins, chat history
Expected Result: User B sees ONLY their own data. None of User A's goals, constraints, check-ins, or chat messages are visible.

Steps:
1. User A completes a check-in
2. Log in as User B
3. View check-in history
Expected Result: User B's history does NOT contain User A's check-in.

Preconditions: Two test accounts with chat history
Steps:
1. User A sends several messages to coach
2. Log in as User B
3. Open chat tab
Expected Result: User B sees clean chat (welcome message) or only their own conversation history.

Steps:
1. Log in as User B
2. Go to Profile > Intervals.icu
Expected Result: User B shows 'Not Connected'. User A's credentials are not accessible.

Preconditions: Knowledge base has been seeded (seed:knowledge run)
Steps: 1. Ask AI coach: 'How does sleep affect my training recovery?'
Expected Result: AI response includes specific exercise science information (sleep architecture; 8-10 hours recommendation; deep sleep importance). Response is more detailed and evidence-based than a generic answer.

Preconditions: Knowledge base seeded with training load docs
Steps: 1. Ask AI coach: 'Explain CTL, ATL, and TSB to me'
Expected Result: AI provides accurate definitions: CTL=chronic training load (42-day); ATL=acute training load (7-day); TSB=form (CTL-ATL). Information is consistent with exercise science.

Preconditions: Knowledge base seeded with injury prevention docs
Steps: 1. Ask AI coach: 'What are common triathlon injuries and how can I prevent them?'
Expected Result: AI provides specific triathlon injury information (runner's knee; IT band; rotator cuff; Achilles tendinopathy). Includes prevention strategies from the knowledge base.

Preconditions: Knowledge base seeded with recovery docs
Steps: 1. Ask AI coach: 'When should I take a deload week?'
Expected Result: AI provides periodization-aware answer about deload weeks (every 3-4 weeks typically). Mentions purpose: physiological adaptation, fatigue dissipation.

Preconditions: On any form screen (check-in or profile)
Steps:
1. Tap a text input field
2. Observe keyboard behavior
3. Scroll while keyboard is open
4. Tap outside the input field
Expected Result: Keyboard appears smoothly. Content scrolls so active field is visible above keyboard. Tapping outside dismisses keyboard. No content hidden behind keyboard.

Preconditions: On any screen that loads data
Steps:
1. Navigate to dashboard (or pull to refresh)
2. Observe during data loading
Expected Result: Loading spinner or skeleton is shown while data loads. No blank screen or flash of incorrect content.

Steps:
1. Disable network (airplane mode)
2. Try to load dashboard or submit check-in
3. Re-enable network
4. Tap retry or refresh
Expected Result: Error message is shown with a retry option. After re-enabling network and retrying the action succeeds.

Steps:
1. Navigate: Dashboard > Check-in > Chat > Profile
2. Use back buttons on sub-screens
3. Navigate between tabs rapidly
Expected Result: Tab navigation works consistently. Back buttons return to correct previous screen. No navigation glitches or stuck states.

Steps:
1. Enable dark mode on device/OS
2. Open Khepri app
3. Navigate through all major screens
Expected Result: All screens render correctly in dark mode. Text is readable. Contrast is sufficient. No white flashes or unstyled elements.

Steps:
1. Enable light mode on device/OS
2. Navigate through all major screens
Expected Result: All screens render correctly in light mode. Consistent color scheme throughout.

Steps: 1. Pull down on the dashboard screen
Expected Result: Refresh indicator appears. Data reloads. Indicator dismisses when complete.

Steps:
1. Log in as new user who skipped onboarding
2. Check dashboard, check-in history, goals, constraints
Expected Result: All empty states show appropriate messaging: 'No check-ins yet', 'No active goals', etc. Each has a call-to-action button.

Preconditions: App is running on mobile device
Steps:
1. Rotate device from portrait to landscape
2. Navigate through screens
Expected Result: Content adapts to orientation without overlapping or cutoff. Or app correctly locks to portrait.

Steps: 1. Navigate to a non-existent route (e.g. /nonexistent)
Expected Result: 404 / not-found page is displayed with navigation back to the app.

Steps:
1. Sign up with new account
2. Complete full onboarding (connect Intervals.icu, enter fitness numbers, add a race goal, choose structured plan)
3. Complete daily check-in
4. Review AI recommendation on dashboard
5. Chat with AI coach about the recommendation
6. Edit profile fitness numbers
7. Add an injury constraint
8. Complete another check-in
9. Verify AI adapts to injury constraint
Expected Result: Every step completes successfully. Data persists across screens. AI responses become more personalized as more data is added. Injury constraint changes AI recommendations.

Preconditions: User with established profile and history
Steps:
1. Open app (session persisted)
2. Check dashboard for today's overview
3. Complete daily check-in
4. Review workout recommendation
5. Ask coach a follow-up question about the workout
6. Check check-in history to review trends
Expected Result: Each step works smoothly. Dashboard updates after check-in. Chat has context from check-in. History shows trend data.

Steps:
1. Add a new race goal (priority A)
2. Complete a check-in - verify AI references the race goal
3. Chat with coach - ask about race preparation
4. Edit the goal to change priority to B
5. Verify AI adjusts priority in next interaction
6. Delete the goal
7. Verify it no longer appears in coaching context
Expected Result: Goal CRUD operations work. AI references active goals in recommendations. Deleting a goal removes it from AI context.

Steps:
1. Add moderate knee injury constraint with 'no running' restriction
2. Complete check-in - verify no running recommended
3. Chat with coach - ask for a workout plan
4. Verify plan avoids running
5. Mark injury as resolved
6. Complete another check-in
7. Verify running is now allowed in recommendations
Expected Result: AI correctly excludes running when injury is active. After resolving the injury the AI resumes full activity recommendations.

Preconditions: Valid Intervals.icu account with recent activity data
Steps:
1. Connect Intervals.icu from profile
2. Go to dashboard - verify activities appear
3. Complete check-in - verify some fields pre-filled
4. Check training load card shows real CTL/ATL/TSB
5. Ask coach about recent training load
6. Disconnect Intervals.icu
7. Verify dashboard shows placeholders again
Expected Result: Full integration cycle works. Real data flows from Intervals.icu through the app. Disconnecting cleanly removes data access.

Steps:
1. Navigate to dashboard
2. Time how long it takes for all cards to load
Expected Result: Dashboard loads within 3 seconds. No card takes more than 5 seconds to populate.

Steps:
1. Submit a complete check-in
2. Time from submit to recommendation display
Expected Result: AI recommendation appears within 15 seconds. Loading/analyzing indicator shown during wait.

Preconditions: User sends a message to AI coach
Steps:
1. Send a coaching question
2. Time from send to first response text appearing
Expected Result: First response text appears within 10 seconds (streaming). Full response completes within 30 seconds.

Steps:
1. Make a change on personal info screen
2. Tap 'Save Changes'
3. Time until success confirmation
Expected Result: Save completes within 2 seconds. No UI freeze during save.
